title: Introducing: Yume
content:
I know what you’re thinking, ‘oh no, not another teenage producer here to make all of us twenty year old’s feel completely and utterly worthless’, right? Well, yeah, that’s pretty much the case.

As with the likes of xxyyxx, Beat Culture and Hollow Pigeons, NY’s Yume (presumably pronounced You-Me) appears to find his inspiration amongst rap and glo-fi artists, with his debut EP Dreamt Of U showcasing a decidedly raw and illustriously unrefined talent.

With cuts from the EP already having popped up on several other blogs (Flashlight Tag, Smoke Don’t Smoke, GITNB) over the last few days, it’s clear that he’s already making an immediate impact on the scene. Personal favourite, the Imogen Heap’s Speeding Cars sampling There There is awash with gorgeous hooks and lush instrumentation, a track with such an alluring atmosphere that it’s impossible to not be emotionally affected. Check out the full EP below and grab a free download from Yume’s bandcamp.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
